scene_metadata.title: The Question's Denial
scene_metadata.description: Evan denies trying to prove anything, challenging the Architect's assumption

dialogue.text: What am I trying to prove? Nothing.
dialogue.context: Rejecting the premise of hidden agenda

dialogue.text: *expanding emptily* I am the absence of agenda! No hidden purpose, no secret goal, just... nothing!
*standing firm* I am the rejection of the Architect's assumption! Not every persistence has purpose!
*remaining empty* Even examined closely, I contain no hidden proof, no secret validation seeking!

visual_elements: An empty space where purpose should be
The Architect's question bouncing off void
philosophical_questions: What does it mean to engage without agenda?
scene_notes: Evan's stark response—'Nothing'—challenges the Architect's assumption that continued engagement must serve some purpose. This denial itself becomes interesting: Is it possible to persist in philosophical dialogue without trying to prove anything? Or does the denial itself prove something?
